articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's military prepared for ground operations in Gaza to root out the Hamas militant group, whose deadly rampage through Israeli border towns last week stunned the nation.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas at war: Latest news

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich said on Sunday the government was taking responsibility for the devastating attack that allowed Hamas militants to enter Israel and kill hundreds of Israeli civilians.
articles.title: Netanyahu partner says Israel's leaders failed to protect citizens

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanese Hezbollah fighters launched attacks on Israeli army posts and a northern border village on Sunday, and Israel retaliated with strikes in Lebanon as U.N. peacekeepers warned border clashes were escalating.
articles.title: Israel-Lebanon border clashes escalate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Sunday that the Egyptian-controlled border crossing into Gaza would reopen and the US was working with Egypt, Israel and the United Nations to get assistance through it.
articles.title: Egypt pushes to break impasse over Gaza aid

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Health officials in the Hamas-run Gaza Strip have resorted to storing the bodies of Palestinians killed by Israeli air strikes in ice cream freezer trucks because moving them to hospitals is too risky and cemeteries are short of space.
articles.title: As Gaza death toll rises, bodies are stored in ice cream trucks

articles.author: Matt Tracy
articles.description: The Israeli-Hamas war has sharpened focus on rising geopolitical risks for financial markets, as investors wait to see if the conflict draws in other countries with the potential to drive up oil prices further and deal a fresh blow to the world economy.
articles.title: Global markets brace for fallout as Middle East tensions rise

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer said on Sunday that the chamber would push through a military aid package to help Israel in its war against the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas.
articles.title: Senate leader Schumer says chamber will rush through military aid to Israel

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Emily Rose
articles.description: Israeli troops prepared on Sunday for a ground assault on the Hamas-controlled Gaza Strip as the country hit back for an unprecedented assault on its territory, and Iran warned of "far-reaching consequences" if Israel's bombardment was not stopped.
articles.title: Gaza braces for Israeli ground assault, fears of conflict spreading grow

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: As Israel intensified air strikes on the Hamas-controlled Gaza Strip and told residents to move south towards the border with Egypt, some like father of six Fadi Daloul thought that would be a safe option and gathered up his belongings.
articles.title: Palestinians fleeing fighting to the south find no escape from danger

articles.author: John Foley
articles.description: JPMorgan’s (JPM.N) boss serves his quarterly earnings with a side of brimstone. The mega-bank Jamie Dimon runs is performing strongly, and yet he openly frets and rants about what’s coming: higher interest rates, smothering regulation, recession, war. The pessimism is something of a schtick that doubles as an asset.
articles.title: Jamie Dimon makes anxiety a feature not a bug
